description:
This review is mostly for their ROTI WITH ICE CREAM. I've never heard of it nor tried and it easily became one of my favorite desserts and I'm pretty simple when it comes to desserts; more so on the less-sweet sorta spectrum. Here's my description on it: flat, flaky, buttery, croissant-like crust, with a slightly chewy dough, which couldn't have paired any better with ice-cream (I actually asked for the condensed milk on the side, I feel like that was a good call).  GAH, it was so good, and I'd visit SF again just for the Roti. I also hear there's so many variations to eating it. Ah, so much to learn about this delicious pancake!

Ok! The food! I just discovered after reading other reviews that the dish I got was a super authentic Thai noodle, ya know the exclusive--which always turns to be those awesome dishes, and it was! I got (#94) Guai Jubb which is a pork themed noodle dish: pork broth (house special broth), pork entrails (innards), egg, crispy pork belly and square rolled up noodles! It was so yummy and fun to eat. My friend got a pretty simple dish, crispy pork belly stir fry with Chinese broccoli and side of rice--smelled AMAZING and tasted great. 

Would def recommend this casual place and would come again (mostly for roti). I can't stop thinking about it...
author: Polina S.

description:
DO NOT ORDER DELIVERY FROM HERE!!!!

In short:
- food came over 2.5 hours later (I only live a mile away and ordered 2 things) 
- food came leaked in the bag, spoiled, and UNEDIBLE
- asked for refund, they wanted the food back, whole ordeal took 4 hours

You've been warned. Honestly, why does this always happen when I want to try new things? I ordered a delivery and they called me after telling me they didn't have one of the items in stock and that I would have to go through delivery.com to get a refund. It was such a hassle having to call them and being put on hold for 10 minutes to get a refund. Super disappointing. Then the delivery came over TWO HOURS later. Won't order from here again. 

I saw that the delivery time would be 45-75 minutes and I waited and waited more than 75 minutes. I called the restaurant after waiting an hour and a half and they said it would be 15 MORE minutes. 

Keep in mind, this was on a Tuesday night and I only live 1.5 miles away! I've never had to wait this long for a delivery. Shame. 

EXTREMELY Poor Service from the restaurant saying they would call the driver and get back to me but never did.

Update: The food came cold, leaked in the bag, and was unedible. I called to get a refund and they said I had to go through delivery.com. Called delivery.com and they told me to call the restaurant. After another 10 minute hold, I called the restaurant and they told that in order to receive the refund, I had to return the food. I returned the food back to the delivery driver and he had the audacity to yell at me and screamed why I didn't say anything about the order when I received it. I calmly replied that it was 10:30PM and it's dark outside so I'm unable to see through a completely opaque white bag. I had realized the food was completely spilled when I got back inside my house. After this entire ordeal, and just wanting to eat some Thai food, I still haven't received a refund yet.
author: Angel D.

description:
Most amazing THAI Restaurant in SF.
Authentic dishes, in a very casual environment.
Location is an issue, but after a day at the beach, is phenomenal-
Every dish is spectacular -
Must check it out - way out west on Geary St.
author: LB B.

description:
If you have ever traveled west on Geary Blvd, in the Richmond district, you probably passed Amphawa a gazillion times... and not realized it.

My go to place was Thai Time until we found several hairs in a dish...and than again. Funny how cleanliness is important to me.

Well Amphawa is super clean and the food super tasty.

Place gets pretty busy so the food is always hot and fresh.

Curries are rich and flavorful and chocked full of meats and veggies.

Noodle dishes are not too oily and have a great texture and flavor.

Service is friendly and efficient.

Solid choice for Thai food!
author: David G.

description: I had friends in from out of town and we brought a big group here because it was near my friend's house in the Richmond. The wait staff was very very attentive but also seemed slightly overwhelmed by our party of 10. The food we had was great! A few friends got various curries , pad Thai dishes, and I got Pad See Ew which was very very good. I especially liked the broccoli in it.  I want to come back to sample more of their menu!
author: Jason P.

description:
First time We dined here during the Day .. 

You'll appreciate this location more during the day...as its very easy to find..Its Conveniently Located on Geary and 19th Ave ..a Major Crossway to Golden Gate Park, Golden Gate Bridge, To Cliff House, To Union Square...

Side from Reasonable Price..Id say...Food here is Really good...Been going to this place for 4 times in a month....Thats how good it is...

Try Their Salmon (its wrapped on Banana Leaf) goes with Vinegar,Garlic,Chili and lime sauce...Add fried rice? you'll loved it...or the Curry Salmon ....Id be Adventurous to try other Dishes as compared to the Traditional Phad Thai (Which is good too).

Come over and Try it ...
author: Donovan L.

description:
Unbelievable i could find this rigid Thai resto in SF !!!
-reasonable price 
-all foods came with fresh ingredients 
-variety of Thai food 

It's called rigid from Thai ppl,so why don't go and taste the real Thai !!! 

Absolutely worth every single cent , u gotta eat there
author: Tiratiwan L.

description: This has by far been THE BEST food we have had while visiting San Francisco. Everything from the service, to the food, as well as the atmosphere is beyond our expectations.
author: Cassey M.

description:
Came here on a Friday night at around 7:30 PM and noticed that it was a bit crowded. My first impression was that the tables were somewhat too closed to one another, but its okay because my friend and I wanted to try out their Thai food. 

We sit down and we had to wait a while for the waitress to come stop by our table to take our order. It's disappointing to say the least because we were sitting literally next to the cash register and I'm pretty sure one of the waitress saw our glances. Nonetheless, the service was a bit lacking.

We ordered the Pad Thai with Shrimp and the Rad Na with Chicken (Noodles with the gravy sauce. Portions are definitely big, but there was quite a lot of oil in it. In addition, the Pad Thai had an odd aftertaste to it. 

Overall, we paid around $25 for the two dishes without tax. I think it would have been a more pleasant experience if the restaurant was also a bit more cleaner. 

They take credit cards and I noticed a lot of people did takeout. It's probably not the best idea to go here with more than 4 people when it's busy.
author: Victor L.

description:
Everything I've ever ordered here has been flavorful. Definitely one of the better Thai spots in the Richmond District!
A fan of the chicken satay, curries, and Pad See Ew!
author: Jonathan B.

description: I love this Thai restaurant! The staff is super-friendly, and the quality of the food is excellent. We customize our dishes every single time, including no added sauce, etc. My fave is the pra ram over brown rice with steamed bean sprouts side dish. You should definitely try it!
author: Jessica Y.

description: The salmon in banana leaf is SO GOOD! The pad see ew is amazing as well.  They are a small place but fast and delicious.  I always love coming here for great thai food
author: Steven H.

description:
Easy spot for a bite. Not the greatest service but that's okay cause the food is delicious and reasonably priced for a big portion! 

Perk of this restaurant is their redone menu! Lots of photos and lots of variety in dishes!
author: Mako U.

description:
*PLEASE NOTE* This place has a poor food safety rating. I did not know this when I visited -  but heads up to any unsuspecting Thai food lover out there! 

I came here on a Saturday night at 10:00pm. I called ahead at 9:50pm to see if we could make a reservation. The person on the phone was a little brisk, and firmly notified me that they close at 11pm, but that they had seating available. That didn't seem like a problem as we were super close by and really craving Thai food. However, I should have taken that phone call of a sign of the abysmal customer service we were about to receive. 

We arrived to a pretty much empty restaurant.. except for a group of 5-6 employees sitting down and eating. We were quickly shown to a table, and placed our orders. Menu was pretty diverse and they had a lot of different drinks at great prices. Our waitress was super curt, anxious, and honestly seemed like she wanted us to leave ASAP. I know the struggle of customer service but when your restaurant is an HOUR away from closing (again.. they close at 11pm) there really isn't an excuse. 

Food was OK. Certainly not worth the rave reviews on yelp. The Pad Kee Mao appeared almost white and the noodles were cut up really short, which was strange. 

She quickly brought us the bill at 10:30pm. As we were still finishing up our food and chatting, she returned at 10:35pm and pushed our bills closer to us (LOL). I honestly couldn't believe what was happening. We were out of the restaurant by 10:40pm.. a full 20 minutes before they closed! 

A word to management: If your employees are so eager to close the restaurant at 10pm.. by all means change your closing time to 10pm or hire different employees for the night shift.
author: Natalie F.

description: I had lunch here during my one hour break right after noon. It was my first time eating here and to be honest I did not even know this place existed. It was one of my co-workers the one who told me about it. We did not have much time so we ordered our food right away. We got a salad with mango, red onions, grated coconut and shrimp. We both liked it a lot and I am sure whenever I come back I'll be getting it again. The other entree was a dish with rice, beef, cucumbers and peanut sauce. In my opinion it was totally bland, and not even the powerful sauce was enough to make the dish more appealing. My co-worker was happy with it and he ate most of it. Anyway, I am happy I could tried this little restaurant, it's conveniently located and I am sure it won't take much time till I go back for more.
author: Daniel G.

description:
Always impressed with the food! New selections are worth trying, like the baby back ribs and crab cakes. Great authentic Thai food.
Love coming back here as always,
Awesome job Amphawa!
author: cathaleeya K.

description: I went to dinner tonight with 2 of my girlfriends.  I order LARP ($9.95) and a side order of rice ($2.00). My total was $11.95 with tax $12+. I told the lady my total with tip will be $15. The lady came back with the total of $15 and when I signed it without adding additional tip because the tip was already included she came back with the check telling me that I did not tip her. 1. That was totally rude of her. A tip is something that the person who is paying feels like giving and it is optional. 2. I tried to explain to her what had happened but she did not understand and still demanded that I tipped her again after each of my other two friends already tipped her 15% each. We usually go there for Thai food but the food tasted bland and to top it off service was horrible. It is safe to say we will NOT be returning.
author: Dimple P.

description:
This is probably the best authentic thai food you can get in SF that also comes with classic american favorites such as the crab fried rice. 

Having been to thailand 3x, I can tell you that the noodles here are legit AF. Try kao soi, pork shoulder and basically every other noodles.
author: Alan L.

description: Peanut sauce is #dank. King Vajiralongkorn would be proud of Amphawa.
author: Myles F.

description:
The food is good but my kids hate fishy smells so we don't frequent seafood restaurants or asian places (aside from Japanese and Indian). I dragged them here, and they had a hard time handling the scents in the restaurant. But ... They enjoyed their food (bbq meat and fried rice) and I did as well (eggplant dish). The Thai iced tea was good. The hibiscus tea was a bit strong, but not bad.

I've been here a few times now and haven't had to wait for a table (lunch and dinner) and service is polite and efficient.
author: lynn t.

description:
I'd say this is one of my go to Thai restaurants in the city. It's generally very easy to get a table when doing a walk-in, the food is reasonably priced, and the quality of the food is pretty decent. The menu here is quite large, but I pretty much stick to the things I know. 

This past week I visited the restaurant with a friend and we ordered the crispy calamari which came with the house sweet and sour sauce. This item is definitely one of my favorites, however I did notice that they've gone down in portion size. It somewhat looked like somebody tried a couple pieces in the back and then brought them to our table. Then we had the Tom Yum prawn soup, which was very flavorful and had very many prawns to my surprise. We also ordered a very simple chicken fried rice, which is extremely good. The rice is always fresh, with little bits of egg and a whole lot of chicken pieces. Then we had the sautéed tofu with mixed veggies, which was full of flavor. The veggies were crunchy and the tofu was sautéed to perfection. Lastly we tried a new dish, which I believe was called grilled barbecued beef steak. This meat dish came with a side of some incredibly delicious sourish sauce. I'm not sure what it was, however, paired with the barbecued meet, it was spectacular. The flavor was out of this world and I would've been up to ordering a second order of it. 

Definitely a restaurant I'd recommend for anyone who loves a good Thai meal. It's very much authentic based on what I've seen. The servers are also very kind and helpful, but they do tend to do their own thing at times and it becomes hard to get their attention. Because I love their food, I don't really focus in on that too much, but for some it may be annoying.
author: Julia K.

description:
I've gotten take-out and dined in at Amphawa and this place is a solid 3 stars. Mediocre thai food, nothing really stood out. And way over priced! This ended up being an $80 meal for my partner and I. At a mediocre restaurant, that's pretty disappointing. 

Also, the service was very slow. We had to ask for water multiple times and the food was very slow to come out.
author: Stephanie D.

description:
3 stars for the food ONE star for the female with the short hair. Rude ass employee, holy shit. If you hate your job that bad why you here. Please PLEASE go somewhere else. Who is the MANAGER? Fix this damn person, they need help. Seriously, it's just sad seeing people so angry like that. Do us all a favor and stay your rude ass home please. I'm only here for the food cause it's great but the service, i always hope to come in when the rude ass lady isn't there, but she's always there. STAY HOMMMMEEE! If you're the manager of this restaurant, and you are reading this, you need to fix her act. Hire someone who is money hungry cause she clearly don't care to be there. 

**Oh and forgot to mention, when we paid cash and then card, she had the audacity with a rude ass voice "is this just your tip?" Excuse me? Did we say this was your tip no we said "CASH AND THEN THE REST ON THE CARD" we already have your tip ready for you, we weren't gonna walk out without leaving her rude ass something cause that's just not us but lord, this person needs a nap.
author: Gerline R.

description:
Amphawa is the most favorite Thai food. The food taste is Thai authentic style.
I recommend to order oysters omelette (Hoi-tord) and chinease square noodle (Kuayjub). They can keep the nature taste for the people who need something different. Not only chicken satay or green curry but also something different.
I don't agree with food alert here because this place is cleaner than other Thai and Chinese restaurants that never get noticed.
author: Chinnakrit W.

description:
Love love love! I've eating from here 2x (once takeout and once dining here) and so far so good. The food is delicious and their cocktails are made with a great balance. 

If coming here with a group, I definitely recommend eating family style so you can try more of their food.
author: Stacey D.

description:
Food took two hours to be delivered. The restaurant would not answer the phone to let us know when the food would arrive and Eat24 wouldn't get back to us either. The food was cold when it arrived. I had to give my son something else to eat because he was too hungry to wait.  I had guests over and it was embarrassing that I couldn't even provide an ETA. 

I sent notes to Eat24 and to the restaurant the next day to share my experience and nobody ever responded. Terrible experience
author: Glen J.

description:
Okay, I heard this place was a really great northern Thai food restaurant... From Thai friends.

So disappointed. Papaya salad was super sweet-wtf, Som Tum Thai was good but it didn't taste any more authentic from what I've made... The broth had decent flavor but the portions were small for what you paid for, the Pla Dook Prig King was okay... The duck had decent flavor as it was fatty but there was so much fat that I only got one or two pieces that were edible. Best of the night was the Kao Koor Pa-Lo. Flavor was good, everything was cooked well.
author: Mandi W.

description: This place is amazing. Their fried rice with yellow Curry, Flat noodles with vegetables are THE BOMB. Great Service. Cool vibe, CLEAN resterooms. Fair prices !!!!
author: Joseph G.

description: The food is excellent they have delivery after five the only problem with ordering is it is so loud in the restaurant you can barely hear the person on the phone and most of the time you can barely understand maybe put the phone in a quieter part of the restaurant. We have also eaten there it's not very fancy and had a weird smell but it seems clean and the food is really good.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
First time my husband and the family and I have been here. The service was excellent! The food was really good too!

The waiter was very nice and was always checking up on us and refilled our waters whenever we were always out that's a plus for us because my husband drinks lots of water.

The place was small but very nice and they managed to fit 12 of us so that was really good. 
Also food came out in a manageable time. 

Overall whenever we are in the area I would come back here and eat!
author: Trang T.

description: The restaurant is small. All the dishes we ordered were very flavorful. We ordered pad see ewe, rad nar, calamari delight, chicken satay, shrimp rolls, an appetizer that tasted like pot stickers but looked like crab rangoon, chicken fried rice, crab fried rice. For dessert, we had fried banana with coconut ice cream, sticky rice with coconut ice cream, pana cotta with strawberry cream. For drinks we had thai iced coffee and thai iced tea.
author: Grace F.

description:
Good service and good food.

Came here last weekend to grab lunch. I was initially head over to Lou's sandwiches but I instead I decided to go with thai food. 

The restaurant is rather small but cozy. I would guess that it seats somewhere between 15 to 20 people or so. The tables are fairly close to each other but spacious enough to walk around rather easily. 

There is a bathroom here so don't feel the need to go elsewhere. 

The menu has a nice selection of options to choose from as well. If there is something specific that you are looking for in your dish feel free to ask the staff. The rice plate options are really good. I will be going back to try more of them in the future.

The drinks selection is just as good. They serve beer, cocktails, and tea. The Thai Tea Lemonade was amazing. If you have never had it I would try it as least once. 

The food was very good. I was pleasantly surprised how well my food turned out. I asked for it to be more spicy that I normally would and it was excellent. There was lots of flavor and spices jumping off the plate. The waitstaff did an excellent job of greeting, taking orders, and serving the food. I also commend the chef(s) that prepared the meal. 

Because I had this spontaneous craving I found the meal to be more that enough to fulfill my craving. 

I highly recommend this place if you are going to be in the outer sunset district and looking for some decent Thai food. They know how to "bring it". 

#thaistyle #TT
author: Robert F.

description:
My first time dining here was with my friend and the second time was with my brother. When my friend and I ate here we had the shrimp rolls, chicken pad Thai, and chicken with the green curry, which was medium spicy to my taste.

The shrimp rolls were ok. The chicken pad Thai was fairly standard, but still good. I loved the curry we had though! It was very flavorful and had just enough spice to it.

The second time visiting this place was with my brother and we had the little fried pouches with minced chicken that looked like tiny money bags, chicken pad Thai, salmon with the green curry, and we had the roti with coconut ice cream for dessert.

The little fried pouches were a good appetizer. Once again, the chicken pad Thai was the same as it had tasted the first time I tried it here. But, I love pad Thai, so I always have to get it. The best dish was the curry with the salmon. The salmon was fried lightly and had such a nice crispy texture to it and paired well with the green curry. The roti was good too!

Overall, customer service could be better because my brother and I had to wait a long time for our dessert and even to get our check. It was during dinner on a weeknight and they were packed with only 2 waitresses. Although the portions may be smaller than usual, I would still come back because the food is very good here and I also wouldn't mind getting takeout.
author: Fallon P.

description:
Nice interior, a very busy restaurant. There were only 2 waitress on the night we came so service was slow, but nonetheless friendly. 

Shredded Green papaya salad- As a main dish, the size is on the small side, like an appetizer. Lots of green papaya, and it is slightly too sour, I wish there are other flavors to balance the acidity

Special pork leg stew- Excellently braised pork! the pork is soft and flavorful, with pickled veggies on the bottom. The sauce that comes with the dish is sour and spicy, perfectly enhance the savory and saltiness of the meat. Highly recommend! 

Pumpkin curry with chicken- chicken was slightly dry, and I wish there were more pumpkin. Nothing too special about this dish.

pineapple fried rice- an average fried rice, they definitely use fresh pineapple, not the overly sweet canned syrup pineapple

Pad Se Ew- Great Pad Se Ew! It is not greasy like other places, but can taste the flavor of the meat. 

Mango Tango- Great dish, the beef was cooked just right at about medium. The mango are young and firm, providing more for acidity than sweetness to the dish. There are also red and green bell peppers, a very balanced dish

Portions are on the small side, but with good quality. Presentation of food is also beautiful! Their dishes are light on seasoning and oil, great for people who prefer lighter and healthier dishes. I will come back if I am not too hungry but craving for high quality thai food!
author: Karen C.

description:
This place has consistently excellent service and a vast, diverse menu.

Favorite: get the fried whole fish. They do it perfectly. It's crispy and delicious. You can eat the fins like chips. 

They are excellent with textures. Tender pork, crispy vegetables--as it should be.
author: Spire S.

description:
Delicious Thai Food! Smaller-than-average portion size but everything was great tasting! 

We tried a few entrees and I really liked the: 
- Kao Ka Moo (5/5): the braised pork leg was delicious and melts when you bite into it. It comes with a sour sauce, which you don't have to use because the pork itself has been marinated with a lot of great flavors. 
- Sauteed Rib Eye with Mango (4/5): The rib eye was cooked to medium rare and was a bit hard to chew into, but I really liked the flavor the mango and the other vegetables added to the dish. 

I wasn't too impressed by the: 
- Pumpkin Curry (2/5): I expected more pumpkin and substance to the curry. The curry base was thin and not as flavorful
- Pineapple Fried Rice (2.5/5): Liked the pineapple chunks but that's about all to this dish.
author: Wendy F.

description: Mostly authentic Thai spot with convenient hours. Their soups shine, especially after a day partying in the park at Outside Lands, Hardly Strictly, etc. Try their Sukothai noodles. And of significant interest here the is the hard-to-find and off-menu "hor mak", or Thai streamed curried fish custard-- don't be shy, give it a try, it's a famous dish in Thailand. Pair with a Singha and a smile! Kap khun krap.
author: Brian J.

description: I like amphawa and order here pretty regularly...but my stomach doesn't love it :( Something about their cooking causes some upset in my digestion, and it's the same for my boyfriend. Though the food is delicious in terms of flavor!
author: Fleur R.

description:
Fairly let down.

Was hoping for an "authentic Thai" restaurant, to me that definition doesn't just mean spicy or using exotic ingredients. The pairing and quality of each dish was lack luster.

The Tom Kha soup, didn't a the aroma, depth of ingredients, or flavor that one would expect at the given price point. Also the presentation was decent at best. 

The spicy cat fish was ok, spicy but the actual deep fried catfish chunks lacks the freshness that I would've imagined.

The price is also a little high for the area and quality of service.
author: Soroosh P.

description:
Ok my opinion may be a little bias, due to the fact that when I came here I was just getting done watching cotto vs canelo and I had over a pitcher by myself.

This place was Thai food heaven, we got the veggie egg rolls as a starter, they were very solid unlike most egg rolls that are flaky, loved that.
We then split Chan pad fo, which were thin noodles stir fried with crab, I truly have no words for this dish it was beyond amazing, tasty and full of flavors.

My commitment is to come to this place sober and to make sure its just as good. However even though I did have a bit to drink I believe I'm pretty accurate, I've been to marnei thai and it doesn't even compare to this place, next time I do want to try different entrees.

Ps: my fiance did not drink and she tought it was awfully good :)
author: Josh Giosue D.

description: Favorite Thai spot in the city. Service is great, to-go is too. Always trying new things on the menu, but pineapple fried rice and pad do foo (fluffy catfish) are my favorites. Reasonably priced and a great place in the Richmond!
author: Levi F.

description: This was a very good Thai restaurant. My grandma and I were on our way to Dragon Beaux however wanted to mix it up and stopped in. It is a relatively small restaurant that seems family-owned and has very high quality of food; I think they take great care in preparing their dishes. We had the shrimp pineapple red curry and instead of rice we asked for thick flat rice noodles which was amazing, and also another curry noodle soup with flat rice noodles. So many complex flavors! We heard the table next to us talking about how he comes here and orders something different every time and is not disappointed and I could believe that. Will come back.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Ordered take out and watched the third presidential debate with some friends. This is enough to make any dinner interesting. 

Papaya salad - 3
Way too spicy for me even though we all like spicy. A bit plain as well in terms of the ingredients and only 3 pieces of shrimp. 

Pad Thai shrimp - 4
Standard pad Thai; good noodles and sauce on this one.

Pumpkin curry with beef - 3.5
Seems like a popular one according to Yelp and its featured on their website. It was good, particularly the chunks of pumpkin, but I wouldn't say amazing. 

Steamed chicken with garlic rice - 4.5
This was our surprising favorite. The garlic rice was delicious, with loads of garlic and the rice a perfect balance of steamed and sticky. Aromatic. The chicken was a good complement and reminded us of a Vietnamese dish that involves steam chicken, rice, and sauces. 

Repeater.
author: Will H.

description: Great authentic Thai food here!  All the other Thai places around the sunset and Richmond aren't very authentic to me.  This place is kinda pricey.  My wife and I will go there for lunch but will spend upwards of $65 for 3 dishes.  I think that it's worth the money.
author: Eric C.

description: Incredible authentic take out. Got the roti with curry dipping sauce, the duck noodles and the koy soi. The Koy so I really stuck out. Incredibly delicious with a thick yellow. Going to ask for Extra onions and garlic mustard next time and get it with mixed seafood! Yum.
author: Priya S.

description:
Good authentic Thai restaurant for takeout or delivery. Worth a visit if you are craving more than pad thai as it has quite an extensive menu. 

Tables are a little close together. TVs too.
author: Debbie C.

description:
I have paid a few visits to Amphawa, and I have to say that there are things that I definitely dig here. 

First, the restaurant is small, but still has lots of space for groups. The place is clean and looks nice. 

Second, most of the food is delicious. The curries are good, but I really recommend their pad sa ew. I also really like their Guai Jubb, which is a soup with pork belly, entrails, and pork blood. I know some people are turned off by that, but I personally love it. The soup is delicious and it comes with rolled up, thick, rice noodles. A few of my friends actually think the noodles are too hard or seem uncooked, but I like them! I guess you'll just have to try it to see! :) 

Lastly, the reason why I am giving 3 stars is because of the service. Although all the servers were quite nice, I wasn't fully happy because our waitress was quite pushy. She seemed very impatient when we were ordering. I understand it can be frustrating being a server, especially if it's busy, but it just seemed like she was annoyed all night. When we were given the tab, she kept coming back and asking if we needed more boxes. While I was putting my food away into containers, she grabbed the containers from me and said, "I help you!" and kept doing that until all our food was packed away. It just seemed kind of rude. Maybe she was having a bad day, but I will update this review if the service seems to improve. 

Overall, I would recommend this place because the food is good, but I did not appreciate the service we received.
author: Christina C.

description:
Good, not great. Service was great. Food was just OK. 

I came here for the Khao Soi dish which was really underwhelming.
author: Linda N.

description: Love this place! My go-to takeout spot, fabulous pumpkin curry.
author: Aliza B.

description:
My favorite Thai spot in my favorite district. It doesn't get any better than that. This district is home to what I consider to be the best area for Dim Sum in the whole city, but it's also an underratted place for great for Thai food. Amphawa is the perfect example of that, as they truly execute on flavor and service. Not to say they don't have their kinks, as service can be slow on a busy days, but there's no denying they know what they're doing in the kitchen. Quick side note: these guys have quite possibly the best Thai iced tea I've ever had, as well as some of the best hot tea I've ever had. That good.

On my recent visit, I had an order of the chicken satay (with the best damn peanut sauce on earth), the pad-see-ew with veggies and red curry with chicken. What can I say? I may be a hardcore Thai fanatic, but that's also something that makes me a tough critic since I look for only the best. I can definitely put Amphawa in my top 5 list for Thai food. Other than the absolutely delicious food, thier ambiance is just awesome. It's a very small place, cozy and welcoming. I'll be the first to admit that the staff who work here are hit and miss, as some days the pressure of a packed place can get to them, but they are always incredibly friendly people. Pro tip: the best way not to hit the dinner rush and get perfect service is going there at 5pm. Enjoy :)
author: Alex B.

description:
This is my favorite Thai restaurant in San Francisco. The food is authentic Thai, and they are not afraid to season the food properly. The coconut soup is outrageously good, and the service is consistently first rate. The waitress that served us had a great sense of humor as well! They have an open kitchen and you can see that everything is cooked from fresh ingredients, none of the frozen pre prepared food you get from some Thai restaurants. An open kitchen is always a good sign. Also their bathroom is clean and the tables are clean. The only thing that distracts from the experience is the blaring TV. Other than that, they would have gotten 5 stars .
I love this place!
author: David B.

description: Really good, yummy food. Good first impression. The servers are nice, smily and polite. I ordered # 63, some kind of curry with shrimp and pineapple. I must admit it was on of the best curries I have had. Not too spicy and not too sweet. The perfect balance. I ordered it over rice and it filled me up. Thumbs up for opening late, til 11:00pm. Hard to find good food after 10:00pm.
author: hha a.

description:
If spicy is what you want you will definitely get it here! i got the Gai Ga Prow (106) with chicken for take-out. WOW. I consider myself to be pretty tolerant of spicy food and my mouth was on fire (in a good way). Despite all the heat, all the flavors were able to come through (chicken, basil, etc..) and so I was a huge fan. if you aren't a spicy food person, just get it mild. You could tell the ingredients were good. I am looking forward to trying their other dishes, especially the green curry. 

This place was votes one of the best Thai restaurants in SF, and as luck would have it, right by my house! Definitely recommend. With so many Thai places in this area, I felt their food really distinguished themselves from the other Thai places around SF.
author: Thielson D.

description:
Initially, I was legitimately surprised that I hadn't yet posted a review for Amphawa.  Then I remembered why - I keep going!  Hard to finish a review when I keep trying more dishes.  Then again, even more reason to do it now, before I end up going back again...

While Lers Ros and Kin Khao are my top Thai restaurants in SF, Amphawa has been my go-to spot for years.  It's the epitome of convenient for me - never a wait for a table, parking is easy, an extensive menu, fair prices, and, most importantly, really good food.  Service can be hit or miss (see below), but it's fine for the most part.

-- HOY TOD - Mussel Pancake with Bean Sprouts & Secret Sauce...$9.95
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/amphawa-san-francisco-2#Y6NiGlu7X3dl4bNdIVwB3g)
It was listed on a separate menu page, but don't miss it.  The crunchy exterior and soft interior were great, but I loved all that mussel flavor!

-- #9 ANGEL WINGS - Fried Chicken Wings with Chili Garlic Sauce & Crispy Basil...$8.95
First time - (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/amphawa-san-francisco-2#x5FB63WQTq6RMexjOy_lYQ)
Second time - (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/amphawa-san-francisco-2#RlJxTi1eW6adSVKngCPv4w)
Marnee Thai's are more well known, but these CAN be just as good.  They just aren't consistent; the wings are juicy and crispy, but the second time, the sauce wasn't as good (or plentiful).

-- #14 ROTI WITH CURRY - Thai Pancake with Choice of Curry (Green Curry Sauce)...$6.95
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/amphawa-san-francisco-2#3myHxY4DiH1NooPVi2SuXg)
Pretty simple, but pretty darn good.  The roti had the perfect consistency and I liked the sauce, even though It could have been a little thicker to help it stick to the roti.

-- #48 KAO KA-PROW MOO KROB - Sauteed Crispy Pork Belly with Chili, Onions, Bell Peppers, and Basil over Rice...$9.95
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/amphawa-san-francisco-2#FWBdUHFgev8be6VHkyADQw)
As a pork belly fanatic, this was easy for me to enjoy.  Every piece was so juicy and I loved how flavorful the sauce was.  Slightly sweet with just a touch of spice.

-- #102 CRISPY CHICKEN & FRIED RICE served with Sweet & Sour Sauce...$9.95
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/amphawa-san-francisco-2#D-iaGL2nrYWN8-ELzg7U0A)
The chicken wasn't bad (a little dry, very crispy), but they gave me white rice instead of fried rice.  What's worse, when I told our server, she tried to argue that's how it's served, despite the menu saying otherwise.

-- #70 CHAN PAD POO - Stir Fried Spicy Thai Noodles with Dungeness Crab, Egg, and Green Onions...$12.95
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/amphawa-san-francisco-2#Nj4pE-SxbUn9M51mZ_4bSw)
One of my favorite Thai dishes, and it's pretty awesome here.  The portion is deceptively large and has the perfect spiciness.  Plus, there's so much crab!

-- #41 KAO MOO KROB - Crispy Pork Belly & Chinese Sausage Topped with Secret Gravy Sauce...$10.95
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/amphawa-san-francisco-2#NQ8MfrLnJv8UDmo75aj9NA)
It felt more Chinese than Thai, but decent nonetheless.  The pork belly's skin was really crispy and the sausage was so juicy.

-- #50 KOR MOO YANG - Grilled Pork Shoulder with Chili Sauce...$10.95
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/amphawa-san-francisco-2#OgTID8EG6Uzpznbp53bftw)
It's served a la carte, so I added a side of brown rice for $2.  Some pieces were a little fatty, but the dish as a whole was really tender and flavorful.

-- #13 KEAW TOD - Fried Shrimp and Pork Wonton served with Sweet and Sour Sauce...$6.95
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/amphawa-san-francisco-2#613AHUVN8M70rkvxC72_kQ)
The wontons were a bit dark (couldn't tell if it tasted overcooked or if the oil was old), but the filling was pretty tasty.

-- #77 AMPHAWA NOODLES - Flat Rice Noodles topped with Ground Chicken, Green Bean, Onions, & Bell Peppers...$9.95
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/amphawa-san-francisco-2#E18eA3UzZ7KxKaQ4wyhMnA)
We subbed out the chicken for beef, but either would've been good.  The noodles were soft and feathery and the dish was well seasoned.  Really good!

-- #108 PRA RAM - Choice of Meat (Chicken) & Mixed Vegetables with Peanut Sauce...$11.95 (a la carte)
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/amphawa-san-francisco-2#dlFG4WbMfDkVvxF6WPkHvw)
It wasn't bad, but I wasn't a fan.  It was certainly better than the last version I had, but I think I just prefer not having my veggies and chicken covered in peanut sauce.

-- ROTI & ICE CREAM...$5.50
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/amphawa-san-francisco-2#O6wff5PTAozXVj6i84wpIw)
This roti had the prefect texture as well, and the ice cream was terrific!  There could have been a little more condensed milk, but that's always true.

WhileI love Amphawa, I'm regrettably rounding down from FOUR AND A HALF.  Most of what I've had has been better than solid, but it's hard to overlook the few dishes that were just okay.  Not that I won't be coming back, especially since I haven't seen that one worker.  That alone might be enough to bump them to five sooner rather than later.
author: Mike L.

description:
Only got take out here but the service on the phone was friendly and quick. We got there around 10 p.m. (one of the few places open around that late on a weekday) and the place was surprisingly still pretty busy. The food was ready when we got there and someone greeted us right away. We paid with credit card. 

Delicious pad thai with shrimp and red curry with beef. The red curry with beef came with lots of veggies (green beans, carrots, red bell pepper, but too much bamboo) which made me happy. They also had brown rice which was made perfectly. The portions were very reasonable for the price.

We don't live in California, was here for vacation, but if we did live here, we'd be back for more!
author: Lan K.

description: Great late night Thai spot in mid Richmond neighborhood area! Probably one of my favorite Thai restaurants in the Richmond / sunset area (sorry Marni Thai) The interior of the restaurant is nicely decorated though the seating configuration is a little odd due to the L shape of the restaurant. It's hard to find a good seat to escape the draft from outside. I liked the diverse menu. They had a good selection of dishes that included the classics and also some different options I am not used to seeing. The menu has a lot of brightly colored pictures to show you some of the menu options. I would definitely come back again. We ordered the pork belly, beef Larb and the yellow curry egg noodle dish.
author: Alice H.

description:
Yearssss ago, I ate at Amphawa's predecessor, Chiang Mai, based on my cousin's recommendation to try their Crying Tigers dish and another grilled shrimp dish (the name escapes me). I recall the food being excellent so when I saw that the restaurant was now called Amphawa (not sure when this change happened), I wanted to visit again. Based on my most recent visits, two within a week and a half, I assume the owners must be the same because the food is delicious! So far I've had: 

* Por-Pier Sod (under apps): I wanted to try this dish because of the sweet and sour tamarind sauce (I love tamarind). The rolls were tasty and not too heavy but the sauce wasn't as exciting as I hoped.

* Som Tum Poo & Thai (under salads): This is the papaya salad with salted crab. I traveled to Thailand last year and eating papaya salads there has changed my life. I never craved papaya salads before but because of how good they were in Thailand, I ate a papaya salad with every meal. I love that they combine sour, salty, and spicy flavors with so much crunch and Amphawa made one that brought me back to Thailand. We ordered the salad medium spicy and it was perfect. During my second visit to Amphawa, I also had the som tum thai, papaya salad with dried shrimps, and unfortunately, the acidity level wasn't as perfect as when I had the som tum poo. 

* Kor Moo Yang (under favs): The grilled marinated pork was so flavorful and tender. It was a bit on the fatty side. 

* Kao Na Ped Pa-Lo (under favs): Like the grilled pork, the duck was tender and flavorful. It sat in a wet sauce, served with another thicker savory sauce, and it's five spice flavor came through. 

* Guai-Tiew Gai Koor (under stir-fried noodles): I was really surprised by how good this dish was - it's pan-fried flat rice noodles with chicken, egg, squid, bean sprouts, green onions and ground peanuts. I usually like thai noodles with a brighter herbaceous flavor (such as pad kee mao) but the eggy-ness of these noodles was so delicious and comforting. I also liked the addition of squid. 

* Pad Kee Mao (under stir-fried noodles): I tried the pad kee mao during my second visit and the noodles were so fresh and all of the flavors were right. Another stellar dish.

Amphawa gets busy, especially during dinner time but service has always been friendly. I'll definitely be frequenting the restaurant and hope to try their noodle soup next time.
author: Maya S.

description:
Started off with some appetizers to share with a party of 4.

Angel Wings: deep fried and sauteed with chili garlic sauce topped with crispy basil. They're delicious, crispy, sweet and salty. Good portion and combination of wings and small drumsticks. I loved it. 

Koong Ket Kaew: marinated shrimp wrapped in egg roll and deep fried served with sweet plum sauce is also a must try! The shrimp is stretched out like a piece of tempura and wrapped with an egg roll. Cute, simple and delicious with sweet plum sauce. 

Toong Egern: minced chicken and vegetable wrapped in a pouch served with cucumber salad. Not a big fan of this. The chicken and vegetables are made into this curry filling, seems like there are potatoes in it too. The flavor is bland but presentation was nice. They're wrapped and tied together like a little bag of treats. 

My main dish was the Kao Soy with egg noodles topped with yellow curry chicken, pickled green mustard and red onions. It was listed under noodle soup and it was far from soup! The  noodles are mixed in a rich, thick curry that you really can't drink with a spoon. It was more suacey than soupy. I couldn't finish it because it was too rich for me. 

Service was great! Our server was the only lady serving, bussing, and looking after all the tables in the restaurant for lunch on a Sunday. She was attentive and made sure our water cups were filled.
author: Janny S.

description:
I've passed by the place on multiple occasion without noticing. But boy was I missing out!! We tried the place last night, the ambience was small and cozy. Very cute for just the two of us but I wouldn't recommend for people more than 5 people. Seating might get harder. The waitress was attentive and she asked if we want the appetizer first or serve whatever was done first. We decide to serve whatever was done first. The time difference was a little slower but it wasn't that bad and the food quality was amazing 

So, let's talk about the food! 

The roti with yellow curry: It was so good that's why I forgot to take a picture

fried catfish with string beans and chilli sauce: a bit salty but for those who are craving a salty dish. I would recommend it. I think I would prefer it a little less saucy. It was delicious. 

Pumpkin curry with chicken: this is my favorite! We had it in mild but the curry still had a good kick. The chicken was on the dryer side but I feel like it's the same for all curry I've ordered in the past. 

My overall experience with the restaurant. I would go back, nice ambience, and food was delicious!
author: Amy T.

description:
Came here for the first time with my family a few weeks ago. And i was surprised that this place was decent. 

We started off with shrimp in egg roll wrappers and that was good. The shrimp was plump and juicy with a crunchy wrapper around it. Combined with the sauce it was pretty good. We also had the pad see ew and the yellow curry chicken. Both were pretty good in terms of flavor. The yellow curry was spicy enough and packed a good amount of flavor. The pad see ew was good. It had a good amount of noodles, veggies and chicken. The sweet soy sauce used wasn't too much and it tasted fine. The pad Thai was standard, it wasn't anything special it kind of tasted like king of Thai's but still not bad. We also had a few more dishes but I can't remember what else we had.

Service was also quick and friendly. Definitely worth coming back here for a another try. Even at 9pm they were still pretty packed and efficient. 

Total for 6: $105
author: Stella J.

description:
2 hours for delivery (quoted 45-1hr). one dish completely wrong (ordered #65 and got some chicken dish instead). eat24 app didn't update anything so i had to call the resto, chat with 24 eats and then give the driver directions after that. then 24eat or eat24, whatever is is, was asking me questions once my food did come, so i couldn't even eat in peace...annoying AF. a really bad, non relaxing delivery experience all around. 

i had wanted to try this place and delivery ain't a good choice...

the pad see ew had two very little veg in the whole order and the chicken was overcooked and dry...oh, did i mention my food arrived cold? 

there are way too many other restaurants out there to repeat any part of this experience.

also, had this popped up before my order...i NEVER would have ordered from here: Following a recent inspection, this facility received a food safety rating that is in the bottom 5% locally, and was categorized by inspectors as "poor."

We will display this alert for six months or until we receive a significantly improved food safety rating for this business based on an unannounced inspection.

While customers deserve access to this important health information, some restaurants have lobbied San Francisco to accept payments in exchange for new scores based on prearranged inspections. We understand the city recently caved and now allows restaurants to essentially buy new scores. To remind San Francisco that public health should come first, and do away with paid inspection scores, give them a call: (415) 252-3800.

GROSS 

DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY OR POTENTIALLY YOUR HEALTH/SAFETY....
author: Wendy X.

description:
LOVE this place so much. Very cozy atmosphere but the food is absolutely amazing. We always order four or five dishes and share them family style. 
The basil ground chicken is amazing with the fish sauce provided on each table. Every curry I've tried is perfect and their sautéed meat dishes always have the most tender and flavourful meats I've ever had. 
For dessert, I had the durian dish which was the first time I've tried durian and it got me hooked. 
I honestly cannot recommend this place enough
author: Sherry G.

description:
i came here to meet a group of friends for dinner...since most of them live in sf, i made the long drive from south bay to meet them.  fortunately for me, traffic wasn't too too bad (maybe i got lucky?) and i was able to score a free street parking space just around the block (free after 6pm that is).

i was slightly under the weather, so i only ordered a side dish of steamed veggies, no oil, no salt, no butter, no other spices.  i had to make sure that i ordered something that wouldn't cause me an upset stomach or any other issues for the long drive back.

for $4, i was given a very generous helping of steamed assorted veggies....slices carrots, broccoli, chinese cabbage, and string beans.  despite the lack of oil, salt, and seasoning, the steamed veggies actually tasted really good!  maybe there was something in the water?  all of the veggies were quite tender, so gentle on the teeth as well as the stomach.  i actually could not finish everything, so i asked for a take home box.

even though i did not partake, i liked seeing what my friends ordered....some curry dishes, some spicy dishes, a nice soup, and a noodle dish.  since there was very little remaining after an hour, i'm going to assume that everyone enjoyed his/her food.  i'll definitely have to come back here on a day when i'm feeling 100% so that i can try some of these exotic looking dishes!

service was pretty good, as our party of 7 was seated immediately even though a few friends were running late.  my water glass was refilled constantly and everyone else's food came out pretty quickly too.  the bill was also brought very quickly, and they were able to put my side dish on a separate check since i had to leave earlier.

solid place with a wide variety of thai dishes on the menu.  i'd definitely recommend this restaurant when visiting the inner richmond.
author: Ellen L.

description:
I went to Amphawa with a friend for dinner the other night and ordered four dishes. 

We had the Fried Calamari with Sweet and Spicy Sauce for appetizer. This was delicious. The calamari was perfectly crispy and works so well with the sweet and spicy sauce. 

We ordered the Jumbo Stuffed Prawns. These were huge prawns still in its shell  with grounded pork stuffed into the bottom with a garlicky fish sauce. I really wanted to like this dish since I'm a huge fan of prawns. The prawns were grilled so it was flavorful, but the pork tasted overcooked and a little dry.

The pad thai was delicious. It was a perfect balance of flavor. A lot of times when I go to Thai restaurants, I feel the pad thai is too sweet. But this was definitely perfect for me.

The Pork Pra Ram over vegetables was one of my favorite dishes! Usually the peanut sauce is a little too thick to my liking, but I love that the peanut sauce was a little more runny.

I definitely would want to come back here to try more dishes. And their cocktails sound so amazing!
author: Andrea G.

description: Good place for food but horrible service. Talking to them on phone clearly is equal to climb a hill
author: Greeshma G.

description:
I have to update my review as Amphawa has become my favorite Thai delivery place. They deliver delicious Thai food time and time again.

Since the roommate mentioned he wanted Thai food today, we of course ordered from Amphawa. It also didn't hurt that we had a 30% off code via delivery.com. We ordered:

8. Pla muk tod: crispy fried calamari served with house sweet and sour sauce ($8.95)
14. Roti with curry: Thai pancake with your choice of curry - green curry ($6.50)
16. Som tum poo salad: shredded green papaya salad with salted crab, tomatoes, green beans, chili and lemon dressing ($7.95)
27. Larb ped salad: minced duck salad with chili, onions, rice powder and lemon dressing ($9.95)
33. Tom yum koong soup: hot and sour prawns soup with tomatoes, lemongrass, mushrooms, green onions and galangal ($10.95)
43. Kao mun gai: steamed chicken over garlic rice ($8.95 entree)
67. Pumpkin curry: chicken in medium red curry sauce with pumpkin, bell peppers and fresh basil ($10.95)
71. Pad thai: pan fried rice stick noodles with shrimps, egg, tofu, green onions, bean sprouts (no peanuts) $9.95

I like super spicy food, so I always note extra spicy with each order. But be careful as they really do make the dishes super spicy. I decided to try a couple new dishes this time around and really loved the Larb ped salad and Pumpkin curry. Of course, the roommate and I ordered our usuals which are always solid: Som tum poo, Tom yum koong and Pad thai.

It's really hard finding a consistently good delivery spot. I'm really glad Amphawa is still around and delivers to my place. I only wish they delivered during lunch hours since I always have to find another spot if I'm craving Thai for lunch.
author: Elena N.

description:
Amphawa! 

I've been wanting to visit this place for quite some time. Located on Geary between 14th and 15th (across from Lou's Cafe), it's located in a very accessible part of town. Let me preface, this visit entailed only appetizers, so take it with a grain of salt.

Naked Ladies (Raw Shrimp) - Not really a whole lot to these, topped with some spicy garlic sauce. I was surprised they included more sauce, should your heart desire more. Good, not great.

Yum Pla Muk (Squid Salad) - For me, I had never seen squid cut the way they did, but I was told it's normal for asian restaurants. It looked like the trunk of palm trees, nevertheless this was a really good salad. The dressing paired with the squid and mixed veggies was tasty.

Angel Wings (Chicken Wings) - These are solid/no nonsense friend chicken wings with a sweet glaze. Personally I didn't think they were angelic, but not devilish either (har har har). Great choice for the less adventurous eater.

As originally stated, these aren't actual entrees, so it's hard to give a thorough assessment. I will be back, til next Thai-mm (time? bad joke, moving on) Amphawa...
author: Aaron C.

description:
How can you tell if a Thai restaurant is any good when there are so many in San Francisco? Being Thai myself and having been to Thailand three times, I've found that you look at who is cooking the food and who is eating at the restaurant. At Amphawa, the cook was Thai and there were Thai people eating at the restaurant. Authenticity verified.

Another strong measure is the menu itself. At Amphawa, there are over 100 items on the menu with regional specialities of Thailand like the Northern Thai kao soi (noodles with a yellow curry) and sai ooua (smoked sausage spiced with curry and lemongrass). I was drawn particularly to the hoi tawd (a crispy mussel pancake/fritter) which is hard to find since most Thai restaurants don't make this dish because it's time consuming. It was so good that I ordered two plates of it. Out of our six dishes, yum kor moo yang (grilled pork shoulder salad) was amazing - succulent pork shoulder tossed in an authentic Thai sauce of lime juice, fish sauce, chilies, and palm sugar. 

You might find another place for your favorite pad thai or pad see ewe but Amphawa should be on your list of Thai restaurants to get a real taste of Thailand beyond the norm. This Thai guy gives Amphawa five stars and a must try if you are in the area.
author: Pari P.

description:
This place has the best Thai food I've ever had, hands down! If I didn't live so far away, I would definitely be a regular here. 

The restaurant is clean and homey and the staff is always really friendly and accommodating. The food is fresh, has a clean taste and has high quality. I'm a pork lover and I especially love all the pork dishes here and they serve a variety like stewed pork leg, crispy pork belly, minced pork, grilled pork...I can go on and on!

Usually when I go eat Thai, I just stick to my 2 main favorites, pad thai and pad kee mao, because they're standard and most places make them right. But when I come to Amphawa, I'm always excited to try new things because honestly, all of their dishes look good. I'm always on the look out for good crispy pork belly and this place does not disappoint. 

So far, my favorite dishes are the crispy pork belly with Chinese broccoli and pork stew noodle soup. Both always hit the spot. 

If you're looking for a great Thai restaurant with high quality food then Amphawa is the place to be!
author: Tiffany H.

description:
Danger, Will Robinson! My friend and I got takeout here the other night and spent all of the next day with terrible food poisoning!

We got fooled by the overall restaurant rating on Yelp, but if you look below, you'll see several complaints of cockroaches and food poisoning. Please be careful not to make the same mistake by eating here!
author: Talia B.

description:
This time we got the Pad Se Ew and the Gai Ga - Prow. Let me tell you, the Gai Ga Prow was something else. Super delicious, and it came with rice, which was also a pleasant surprise. I ordered it spicy and that was the perfect amount. It would easily stretch to two meals, too, but I didn't want to because I wanted to keep eating.

The Pad Se Ew, though, was super disappointing. Bland as the day is long. I ended up having to add my own sauce to it to make it better.
author: Chris S.

description:
Came here tonight. Food was good. But before the food shows up there's  a cockroach hanging right next to my face. So gross. When I told the waiter he wasn't even fazed. So so so so so gross. 

Why did I eat the food? Didn't want to be rude among my friends who were excited to eat here. But so gross. Hard to eat when your thinkin about crawling bugs. Ugh
author: Saralee L.

description: Pom (our server) was super friendly. The restaurant can fit around 25 people so I always call to make a reservation for dinner. My personal favorite dish is pork neck (kor moo yang), it is so tender and goes well with sticky rice. Their mussel pancake is also great to share. It is crispy on the outside but soft and gooey on the inside. Their kao soy is also pretty good. I asked for lime and they gave me plenty to add to the curry noodle soup. Their crispy catfish salad (yum pla dook foo) is super authentic (great sour flavor and has mango slices and all of the ingredients). Lastly, their kao mun gai (chicken fat rice) is a must.
author: Norases V.

description:
Awesome delicious authentic Thai food in town!
Been here like a million times and so good!
author: Lisa L.

description: This is one of my favorite neighborhood restaurants.  The food is delicious and I am never disappointed no matter what I try!  Still making my way through their gigantic menu!   The staff is kind and the atmosphere is simple and nice.
author: Rachel ..

description: My favorite go-to in the neighborhood. The food is delicious. I've tried most of the dishes on the menu and never got disappointed. The seafood and curry dishes are my favorite - fresh and flavorful!
author: Lynn S.

description: My wife & I have been going to Amphawa quite a lot  the past few years, and I gotta say, I'm still really impressed with what they got going. This place does Thai food right. What really makes me dig this spot is the consistency they have with all their dishes. For example: The Khao pad Boo (crab fried rice) I had there 5+ years ago is as delicious now as it was then. I have not been disappointed with any dish I've ever ordered from Amphawa. Truthfully the only reason I don't rock this spot more often is that I live frikin far from it. Something I also appreciate is that they try new things. They introduce new Thai dishes, and by doing so that shows me they're pushing their skills more & more. They don't just sit back & chill. They innovate, create & keep on pushing to make better & better Thai food. If your a fan of Thai food give this place a shot & remember to experiment with different dishes. Don't just go once. Go a few times before you pass judgement. I'd say Amp has at least 20 really strong, notable dishes. This place will have a few that you'll like.
author: Gilbey G.

description: Update - have been coming back since I love it, but this place has a consistency issue.  The Sukothai noodles have never been quite as good as the first 2 times.  Also I just had a pretty bad curry - super watery, almost broth like, and the tofu was a bit sour (on its way to going bad).  I would stick with non curry dishes like noodles, rice plates, etc - as their curries (not just this time but other times as well) have not been as relatively good as the other dishes.  Their Khao Man Gai (chicken over rice) is still one of the best in the city though.
author: Olivia T.

description:
On Thursday evening we were walking by this place under construction called Tea Papa on Balboa between 6th and 7th, he said that there used to be a Thai place, it had excellent gang jered woori sen (silver noodle soup), the best, really, and he was sad to see the restaurant gone. I've only started exploring this neighborhood this year (part of my new year food resolution), and really could not comment on the comings and goings of the ethnic food scene here, other than there seems to be a lot of restaurants in the neighborhood and parking is not as hard as I once thought to be. He sighed that evening. "I really miss their soup. Too bad it's gone." 

Fast forward a few weeks later. We were heading to Geary to run some errands. It was close to 3 PM when I was all of sudden snappy. One could tell because I became a raging bxxxx and I snap at the most trivial things.  "You need food." He said. "No I don't. I am fine." I was getting testy. He stopped in front of Amphawa, and said "We are going in." "No I'm not hungry." I insisted but he grabbed my arms and practically dragged me inside.

The wait staff was very friendly. There was a TV mounted on the wall, the screen was filled with photos of varies dishes served here. Travel channel was on the other TV. I asked for the larb salad and he went for a beef special. At that point, I all of sudden realized that I was starving. Food arrived swiftly and the dishes looked beautiful, clean and flavored just right. I inhaled the food. And wished there was another stomach that I could use to pack additional food. Alas, I was no camel.  

As I was feeling more like myself again, he all of sudden excitedly announced to me, "I found my chef. She's the one who used to cook at that Thai restaurant before it was Tea Papa. She cooks here now. And they have jered woori." 

Just like that, I knew the outlook for future Thai food consumption was changed forever in Inner Richmond.
author: Victoria E.

description:
The Tom Kha Gai was super salty and was mostly lemon grass and ginger. Which was annoying to pick out. The green curry came with rice and so it was literally half rice and very little food. Which is unfortunate because we ordered 2 servings of rice in addition to our order. To top it off, I found a sliver of plastic in my food.

Will not be ordering from here again. But the delivery person was very nice.
author: Roni B.

description:
Service: Terrible. Waitresses are rude and don't care for the customers.

Food: The food may appear decent but the food has no flavor and you regret that you didn't choose another Thai restaurant. 

Yellow curry: Yellow curry? You mean yellow colored water?

Pad see yew: I take it back. This dish did have flavor. If you like a plateful of grease and salt give it a try.

Pad thai: The least worst of the three. It was edible.

There are so many awesome Thai restaurants in the city. Don't waste your time.
author: Courtni W.

description: This restaurant is by far my favorite Thai restaurant in the Richmond district. The servers are always nice and helpful the food is delicious.I like the way they ask you how spicy would you like your meal, because I love spicy food.my wife and I had a variety things from the menu and always satisfied.
author: Pat C.

description:
Delish! Since there are so many Thai joints out there nowadays, it's hard to tell when a place is authentic, but we felt pretty great about this one. Here's what we got!

93. Sukhothai Noodle Soup - incredibly spicy. I like my fair bit of kick, but ordered medium spice, to be safe, and still ended up with my mouth on fire. Even so, this was so good! Just a touch sweet, and the meats were incredible. I also opted for the yellow egg noodle, which I highly recommend - a perfect combo!
94. Guai Jubb Noodle Soup - interesting. I like some b-side parts of animals, but entrails are not my fav. Nonetheless, a really delicious broth (also a bit sweet!), and really interesting square rice noodles - I'd never seen them before! Personally, I like the satisfaction of slurping long noodles, but to each their own. 
136. Kao Rad Na Pak (Vegetarian) - greatly refreshing, and just the veg we needed to balance out the noodle and meat. A perfect counterpart to that very challenging #93 noodle soup. :P

Definitely looking forward to visiting again and exploring more of the menu. Fair warning, though - the next morning, I encountered some stomach issues, and wonder if it was the spicy of noodle soup #93. Nonetheless, I will return for a less spicy options. Maybe I'm off my rocker, but oh wells!
author: Shendi X.

description:
I'm Thai and this is my go to Thai restaurant in SF.

I've been coming here for several years and have always left feeling full, happy, and satisfied. I recommend getting their Pad Thai with shrimp, Ka nam moo grob (crispy pork with Chinese broccoli), and khao moo yang (grilled pork neck).

The service is excellent and the food is delicious.

Be sure to try their sweet roti for dessert!
author: Song Y.

description:
Really good Thai food in a simple, nice, small place. 

We got the vegetarian egg rolls, which were good and hot AF (temperature). The wife got the Thom Kha Ga (sp?) soup - chicken soup with coconut milk, lemongrass, etc, which she gets at every Thai restaurant she goes to. The serving was very large and enough to share. She proclaimed this one to be the best she's had. 
The daughter got a noodle dish with crab, which the waitress asked if she wanted it to be mild or medium. She chose medium and it was hot AF (spicy). We all like spice (me especially), but my daughter had to down lots of water and take breaks while eating. But, that's how good it was, she kept going, despite the burn. 
I had a steak salad which was good, but not great. My fault for trying to be low carb in a Thai restaurant (the dressing was sweet too, so I don't think I achieved my goal).

All in all, a very solid experience. We'll be back next time we're in the neighborhood.
author: Jose d.

description:
Service and food were great as usual. Then as I picked up my curry bowl to slurp the last of the curry, a LIVE ADULT ROACH ran out from its hiding place. So it was between my bowl and saucer the entire length of my meal. Terrifying for the both of us I'm sure. We flagged a waitstaff over and quietly, calmly told them what happened. A lukewarm apology was offered and we paid our bill and left, leaving behind half a portion of pad Thai noodles. Sadly, this past favorite has been added to our ban list. 

P.S.   My family ran a restaurant for many years so I understand the trials and tribulations of running a mom and pop business. Still, I hoped for more of an effort to retain our business than a lukewarm apology and nothing more.
author: Empress C.

description: It grieves me to have to do this. The service has let the side down dramatically. I've been coming here for many years, as Chiang Mai, and no as amphawa. Many many times. I knew the owner.  His daughters. His wife. All through coming here so often. They brought me their homemade spicy sauce especially for me as they knew I loved really spicy food. These past few occasions haven't been as awesome. A few times, no egg rolls. Service non existent. Sometimes rude. All topped off by an incident this past week. My glass of water came out hot. Not warm, hot. It took me 10 minutes to get servers attention in an empty restaurant (by walking to the counter). She said the glass was warm. Not the water. I begged her to dip her fingers into it and see for herself that it was warm. She refused. Pretty much called me a liar. Refused to get me another glass of water. Im a 20 year bartender. Not years old, years in the business.  I'm polite and tip very well everywhere. This blew me away. Refused to get me a glass of cold water!!! Now, not to seem completely one sided, their egg rolls are really good. Gai kaprow is damn good. But I won't be able to have it anymore. I refuse to frequent a place where I am treated like scum.
author: ODHRAN M.

description: We've been ordering from here via eat24 for a while and honestly, it's hit and miss. I was struggling between 2 and 3 stars and went with 3. Unfortunately, the last time we ordered was a big miss. First, they give an option ranging from "not spicy" to "very spicy" and we always order "not spicy" (and then add an extra note that we don't want spice. Yet every time the food is way too spicy for us. The pad thai noodles were waaaaay overcooked and mushy, and the entire dish was sitting in a pool of oil. It was gross. I think it was our last time ordering from here. :-(
author: Amy B.

description: Always good food, but the service is slow. Been coming here for years, the staff is courteous, but slow, so I have become use to it. What can I say, the food is excellent!!
author: Xavier G.

description:
5/5 Pad Thai - The best Pad Thai I've ever had! 
5/5 Roti - The best Roti I've ever had! 
Thai Tea - Delicious as always but not too different from other Thai teas I've had. 
4/5 Crying Tiger - Super tender beef 
4/5 Squid Salad- A little spicy but good if you like squid. 
3/5 Pad Woon Sen - I was disappointed by this dish. I ordered it because it's usually my favorite thing to order at Thai restaurants but it was my least favorite of the dishes we ordered. 

Parking: I caved and parked in the metered parking right in front of the restaurant because I was too lazy to find parking. Parking meters in San Francisco are so expensive! 

Reservations: No need to make reservations here! The restaurant was pretty empty when we had lunch Saturday at noon.
author: Karen L.

description:
I think this is the best Thai delivery option in the area. The food is solid and it always shows up hot. I've picked up a few times which is quite a bit faster. 
I would recommend the yellow or green curries and the pad Thai.
author: Sam A.

description: This is one of those "gourmet" Thai places. I got the Pad See Ew and the portion was much smaller than I expected but it was still very good. It wasn't oily like some pad see ew's are. My mom got the pumpkin curry. And I have to say it was very creamy and delicious. And the pumpkin chunks were very large.  Service was nice. It's a bit pricey though. This is one of those places I'd go for special occasions.
author: Anne F.

description:
After the last 3 years of dining here at a frequency of almost every 10 days, my husband and I conclude that this is our fav restaurant in the city! 

The food is fantastic: authentic and balanced flavor. Their menu is extensive yet each has its own unique taste note.

The price is exceptionally reasonable. Where else can you go in SF that an entree is around $10 for generous portion. 

The place is clean and nicely decorated. The service is efficient yet attentive. If we live near here, we probably dine here every week. We drive across town to eat here! And it's worth it every time.
author: Tracy L.

description: The panang beef curry was anemic.  Some places give you enough vegetables to fill you up without rice.  This isn't one of those places.
author: Sarah S.

description: Appetizers were really good (Roti with red curry, and chicken satay). Both were absolutely delicious. The sauces were excellent. The pad see ew wasn't as good but still decent. Not as flavorful as I'd have liked and it was kinda just ok. The tables are small and seating is awkward. But overall I would come back just for the appetizers again.
author: Nina X.

description:
This place is not where it was when I rated it 5 stars a year ago. It now smells like wet dog when you walk in and the service is nowhere near where it used to be. I think they focus so much on their phone and eat24/to-go orders that they no longer care about the people inside the restaurant. 

I will still give it 4 starts because the food is still pretty good, but the service and quality of the restaurant has unfortunately receded.
author: Sarah K.

description: It is a very nice and friendly place. The food is amazing. Shrimp and pineapple curry is the must to try. Prices are reasonable. I've been coming here for awhile and have never left disappointed.
author: Jabari G.

description:
Very very greasy...food with little to no taste.
With all the Thai restaurant out there you can find better.
author: Renaud P.

description:
Being a completely overworked zombie these days, I either lug my laptop around if I eat out or just order delivery. Ordered delivery from Amphawa for dinner today because I didn't want to step out of the apartment looking like a crazy caveman.

Speedy delivery and the food came fresh. Just no napkins or utensils in the bag. I guess I could just eat like a caveman too.

Got the shrimp pad thai, crispy pork belly with chili/onions/bell peppers/basil over rice (#48), and roti with condensed milk to make the $20 delivery minimum. 

Still sitting at the kitchen table working relentlessly into the night and hating my life, but the disgusting monster in(/that is) me destroyed all the food and everything tasted pretty good, albeit too oily.

(Quick version: quick and fresh delivery, decent but greasy food, I feel fat and overworked and hate my life atm)
author: Tian Q.

description: Terrible food. Tried this place a few months back and thought the food was good. Then tried it again last night and couldn't finish my plate. I had the chicken noodle soup, which smelled horrid when I received it and tasted even worst as I began to eat. Something must have changed with their staff. Whatever the case, I'll never eat there again.
author: Louis R.

description: If I can give this place 0 stars I would! Ordered for the first time from here via Postmates. My order was supposed to be $18.00 total simple pas Thai and pad see. Food had an old oily taste to it with no flavor. Worst Thai I ever got and I get Thai all the time! Me and my son ended up getting food poisoning and on top of it the restaurant ended up charging us $28 instead of $18. After reviewing some of their reviews on Yelp seems like we are not the only ones who got food poisoning! Lesson learned!!!
author: Lala S.

description:
So it took over an hour and half to deliver, we were calling to cancel the order because it was taking twice as long as they have quoted. The delivery guys demanded on the tip saying how it is not his fault, but we didn't tip him as they took an hour and forty minutes. 5 minutes after he left, he texted 

What is my fail? Today busy I pick order 5-8order per time. U just waiting at home, dont do anything. It okay next time if I got 233 parker apt08 I'll take this last order or 2hr. U dont care, Why I have to care. Bye

Really? Awesome customer service. Just don't bother ordering delivery from here. It's unfortunate since the food is good but not worth waiting for two hours.
author: Jane H.

description:
My girlfriend raved about this place, and I too was very impressed by it. We came here on a Sunday, close to 1 PM, and there weren't many people. It's not too big, but had a welcoming feel to it, with a large TV and pictures of food off of the menu on the wall. The menu was also huge, over 100 dishes (and I couldn't wait to try new dishes.)

We had ordered Pad Se Ew, Gai ga - prow with rice, Yum Kor Moo Yang salad, and mango sticky rice.

Pad Se Ew - it came out hot, temperature wise, and had pretty good in flavor. I tend to judge Thai restaurants based off their Pad Se Ew, and I definitely enjoyed eating it here. However, I felt like the portion could've been larger and there could be more Chinese broccoli.

Gai Ga - Prow with rice - this was delicious, with subtle peppery flavors here and there. There was a decent amount of rice given as well.

Yum Kor Moo Yang - this was the standout, as I've never had this dish before. The pork was extremely flavorful, and paired well with lettuce. I found it had a bit too much lime, but still loved the dish.

Mango sticky rice - this was great as well, especially as it is mango season now. They gave a lot of mango, and the sticky rice was excellent.

Overall, really enjoyed the place and I can't wait to come back.
author: Albert H.

description:
So many great flavors here.  It may be billed as a noodle house, but the curries really shine here.  The service is always super friendly.  But I suggest ordering out...if only so your house can treasure the meal too!  Going with groups would be a great idea, so you can order from the diverse menu.  

MUST HAVES: 

Gang Ped 
Boneless duck in red curry with tomatoes, pineapple and basil. Made with coconut milk. $12.95
author: Herb K.

description:
Stopped in unexpectedly for dinner. The place was highly recommended by the folks at HARVEST across the street. 

Great food, fair prices and excellent service.

A definite recommend.
author: Ron S.

description:
ALOT of people get take-out here. My family and I dined in for fathers day. I gotta say, this place is authentic as it gets for thai food in SF. Every dish was magnificent. I came back the week after and same consistency. This is my new go-to thai restaurant. 
Order sticky rice instead of regular rice. Their sticky rice is bomb.
author: Kev L.

description: We went there for lunch yesterday and order some take out for my kids too.  At might night we all got foods poisoning till now.  :(
author: Jackie T.

description:
I absolutely love this restaurant.

Cozy interior? Check. Friendly customer service? Check. Amazing, mouthwatering food? Check. I've been here numerous times and every dish has been worth ordering again. 

Appetizers:
- Deep fried fish cakes served with cucumber salad and ground peanut ($7.95): arrived piping hot and juicy. I've had my fair share of hockey-puck dry fish cakes and these were definitely not that. It was delicious.
